page.title: 13LOCHGOILHEAD-FARMING(2)
page.content: Corrow Farm is owned by Mr.D.Campbell and run by his sons Keith,Allan and Roy.The farm is mainly hill ground but there is some flat land near the loch. Corrow is mainly a sheep farm but the also breed highland ponies. They have approximately 600 sheep which are mainly{Scottish Blackface.} They have introduced{Suffolk tups}and{ {Texel tups}to cross with the blackface to produce a carcass with more meat. The sheep are over-wintered inside. For feeding the animals they cut grass for hay and silage.Quite a lot of concentrate feeding is bought. They breed{Highland Ponies}for showing and for their riding centre.They are successful at showing and have won many cup,including the championship at the Royal Highland Show.They have about 40 ponies.
